revised_title: On the Influence of Soluble Substances on Spontaneous Evaporation
tldr: The author investigates the effect of soluble substances on the rate of evaporation of water. Different salts and other soluble substances in solution are found to have varying degrees of power in retarding or accelerating evaporation. The study provides insights into the factors affecting evaporation and the potential use of pans as hygrometers.
